greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The denominator of 2/n^3.
comment: Take two consecutive triangular numbers t1 and t2 and create a triangle using (0,0), (t1,t2) and (t2,t1).  The area of this triangle will be ((n+1)^3)/2 for t1=n(n+1)/2.  - _J. M. Bergot_, May 08 2012
Multiplicative because both A000578 and A040001 are. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 26 2018
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,4,0,-6,0,4,0,-1).
program: (PARI) a(n) = if(n < 1, n==0, lcm(2, n^3)/2) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 25 2018
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Apr 03 2007
